Retuns in szMask the specified (if possible) mask of this user.
If the host or username are not known , the mask may contain less information than requested.
Mask types:
0 : nick!user.host.top (nick!user.XXX.XXX.XXX) (default)
1 : nick!user@*.host.top (nick!user.XXX.XXX.*)
2 : nick!user@*
3 : nick!*.host.top (nick!user.XXX.XXX.XXX)
4 : nick!*@*.host.top (nick!user.XXX.XXX.*)
5 : nick!*@*
6 : *!user.host.top (*!user.XXX.XXX.XX)
7 : *!user@*.host.top (*!user.XXX.XXX.*)
8 : *!user@*
9 : *!*.host.top (*!*.XXX.XXX.XXX)
10: *!*@*.host.top (*!*.XXX.XXX.*)
11: nick!*user.host.top (nick!*user.host.top)
12: nick!*user@*.host.top (nick!*user@*.host.top)
13: nick!*user@*
14: *!*user.host.top (*!*user.host.top)
15: *!*user@*.host.top (*!*user@*.host.top)
16: *!*user@*
17: nick!~user@*.host.top (nick!~user.XXX.*) 18: nick!*@*.host.top (nick!*.XXX.*) 19: *!~user@*.host.top (*!~user.XXX.*) 20: nick!*user@*.host.top (nick!*user.XXX.*) 21: *!*user@*.host.top (*!user@*XXX.XXX.*) smart versions of the masks 17-21 that try take care of masked ip addresses in the form xxx.xxx.INVALID-TOP-MASK 22: nick!~user@*.host.top (nick!~user.XXX.*) 23: nick!*@*.host.top (nick!*.XXX.*) 24: *!~user@*.host.top (*!~user.XXX.*) 25: nick!*user@*.host.top (nick!*user.XXX.*) 26: *!*user@*.host.top (*!user@*XXX.XXX.*) If some data is missing , these types may change:
For example , if hostname is missing , the mask type 3 or 4 may be reduced to type 5

Referenced by KviIrcMask::mask().
